citeinfo.title: Mineral Commodity Summaries 2024 - SELENIUM Data Release

descript.abstract: This data release contains the U.S. salient statistics and world production data extracted from the SELENIUM data sheet of the USGS Mineral Commodity Summaries 2024.
descript.purpose: Published on an annual basis, the USGS Mineral Commodity Summaries report is the earliest Government publication to furnish estimates covering nonfuel mineral industry data. Data sheets contain information on the domestic industry structure, Government programs, tariffs, and 5-year salient statistics for over 90 individual minerals and materials.
descript.supplinf: Where possible, data are those finalized for publication in the 2022 U.S. Geological Survey Minerals Yearbook Volume I - Metals and Minerals. For 2023, USGS National Minerals Information Center provided estimates based on available data from USGS surveys of the industry, other industry sources, and mineral commodity specialist research.

idinfo.accconst: None. Please see 'Distribution Info' for details.
idinfo.useconst: None. Users are advised to read the dataset's metadata thoroughly to understand appropriate use and data limitations.

citeinfo.title: USGS National Minerals Information Center Selenium and Tellurium Web Page
citeinfo.othercit: Provides information and links to all available USGS National Minerals Information Center publications about SELENIUM by publication type and year.

attracc.attraccr: Where possible, data for all years except 2023 have been finalized for publication in the U.S. Geological Survey Minerals Yearbook Volume I - Metals and Minerals; otherwise the data are noted as estimated.

dataqual.logic: Data were checked to ensure that they match those published in the Mineral Commodity Summaries 2024. Data were peer reviewed by Mineral Commodity Specialists and approved by supervisors in compliance with USGS fundamental science practices.
dataqual.complete: This data release contains tabular data found in the associated publication Mineral Commodity Summaries 2024 (MCS 2024); additional detailed information is available in the full text version of MCS 2024.

citeinfo.title: USGS Minerals Yearbook Volume I - Metals and Minerals

srcinfo.srccontr: Source of salient statistics for 2019 through 2022 and basis for estimates for 2023. The data in the Minerals Yearbook are based on USGS surveys sent to companies involved in the industry for each mineral commodity.
trade statistics for 2019 through 2022 and basis of trade statistics estimates for 2023

procstep.procdesc: Salient statistics for each mineral commodity were compiled from published 2022 U.S. Geological Survey Minerals Yearbook Volume I - Metals and Minerals chapters or from finalized tables of those to be published. Data for 2023 were estimated based on available 2023 data and industry trends. Estimates for world production were made for 2023 in collaboration with USGS National Minerals Information Center Global Minerals Analysis specialists using best available data.

enttyp.enttypd: Comma Separated Value (CSV) file containing data.

attr.attrdef: Publication containing the data.
Mineral commodity for which the data were compiled.
Year for which the data were compiled.
U.S. production: Refinery. Data are estimated for the most recent year.

edom.edomvd: Withheld to avoid disclosing company proprietary data.

attr.attrdef: Imports for consumption: Selenium metal. Data are estimated for the most recent year.
Imports for consumption: Selenium dioxide. Metric tons selenium content. Data are estimated for the most recent year.
Exports, metal. There was no exclusive Schedule B number for selenium dioxide exports. Data are estimated for the most recent year.
Consumption: Apparent, metal. Defined as production + imports – exports + adjustments for industry stock changes. Data are estimated for the most recent year.

edom.edomvd: Withheld to avoid disclosing company proprietary data.

attr.attrdef: Price: Average, dollars per pound. Selenium metal powder, free on board, U.S. warehouse, minimum 99.5% purity. Source: Argus Media Group, Argus Non-Ferrous Markets.
Average annual price for selenium powder, in warehouse, Rotterdam, 99.5% minimum purity. Source: Argus Media group, Argus Metals International.
Stocks: Producer, refined, yearend. Data are estimated for the most recent year.

edom.edomvd: Withheld to avoid disclosing company proprietary data.

attr.attrdef: Net import reliance as a percentage of apparent consumption: Metal. Net imports are defined as imports – exports + adjustments for industry stock changes; export data are incomplete for common forms of selenium, which may be exported under unexpected or misidentified forms, such as copper slimes, copper selenide, or zinc selenide. Data are estimated for the most recent year.

enttyp.enttypd: Comma Separated Value (CSV) file containing data.

attr.attrdef: Publication containing the data.

Country in which the mineral commodity is produced. Excludes U.S. production. Australia, Iran, Kazakhstan, Mexico, the Philippines, and Uzbekistan are known to produce refined selenium, but output was not reported, and information was inadequate to make reliable production estimates.

codesetd.codesets: Geopolitical Entities, Names, and Codes (GENC) Standard

attr.attrdef: Description of the form of commodity for which the production is measured, usually mine production (content of the mineral commodity in the ore) or refinery production of the mineral commodity.

edom.edomvd: Refinery production of selenium. Insofar as possible, data relate to refinery output only; thus, countries that produced selenium contained in blister copper, copper concentrates, copper ores, and (or) refinery residues but did not recover refined selenium from these materials indigenously were excluded to avoid double counting.

attr.attrdef: Production in 2022.
Estimated production in 2023.
Production notes, if any

attrdomv.udom: Excludes U.S. production. Australia, Iran, Kazakhstan, Mexico, the Philippines, and Uzbekistan are known to produce refined selenium, but output was not reported, and information was inadequate to make reliable production estimates.

attr.attrdef: That part of the reserve base that could be economically extracted or produced at the time of determination. The term “reserves” need not signify that extraction facilities are in place and operative. Reserves include only recoverable materials; thus, terms such as “extractable reserves” and “recoverable reserves” are redundant and are not a part of this classification system. Additional information is available in Appendix C of the Mineral Commodity Summaries, included in this data release, for resource and reserve definitions and information concerning data sources.
Country-specific reserves notes. See Appendix C, included in this data release, for resource and reserve definitions and information concerning data sources.

attrdomv.udom: Country-specific notes on reserves, if any.

overview.eaover: Two CSV files were produced from the data published in the Mineral Commodity Summaries 2024. One includes U.S. Salient Statistics for production, consumption, trade, and other data pertinent to SELENIUM for the years 2019 to 2023. The other includes world SELENIUM production totals for countries that had production in 2022 and (or) 2023.
overview.eadetcit: Companion data for SELENIUM data sheet of Mineral Commodity Summaries 2024

cntaddr.address: Denver Federal Center, Building 810, Mail Stop 302

distinfo.distliab: Unless otherwise stated, all data, metadata and related materials are considered to satisfy the quality standards relative to the purpose for which the data were collected. Although these data and associated metadata have been reviewed for accuracy and completeness and approved for release by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the display or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty.
